description.narrative: Output1.1: Comprehensive mechanism for child and adolescent nutrition interventions strengthened, especially in the regions with high malnutrition rates.

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Data/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use for nutrition in middle childhood and adolescence
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
IMNCI / Integrated Community Case Management (iCCM) - Community
Prevention of overweight and obesity in adolescence (10 to 19 years)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Social and behavioural change communication for ECD

UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

Maldives 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Maldives Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

related-activity.ref: 2740/A0/06/881 EQUITABLE AND QUALITY SOCIAL SERVICES FO

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output1.1: Comprehensive mechanism for child and adolescent nutrition interventions strengthened, especially in the regions with high malnutrition rates.

description.narrative: UNICEF Maldives Country Office launched the SBCC strategy on the first 1000 days of life, along with a new mobile app “Yagooth” to raise the profile and spread accurate information about healthy eating habits on infant and young child feeding practices (IYCF). UNICEF and partners reached the caregivers of over 1500 parents of children aged 0-23 months with counseling in IYCF practices, contributing to improved infant feeding practices in these islands. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2019

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Community health workers trained with UNICEF support to provide counselling for early childhood stimulation as part of their infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year

actual.value: 2016:out of 75 trained on IYCF (though 3 trainings), one training (26 health workers) addressed ECD and IYCF. ECD integration into the IYCF programme and the growth monitoring promotion is on going and will continue in 2017.

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received counselling on IYCF
Implementation of programmes to improve diet diversity in children

target.value: 2020:First 1000 days of life SBCC strategy (that address dietary diversity) implemented in 15 islands

actual.value: 2019:SBCC strategy (that includes dietary diversity) Implemented in 12 islands

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of a national social and behaviour change communication strategy on IYCF

actual.value: 2017:The SBCC strategy for first 1000 days of life, which has a high focus on IYCF and ECD is being drafted. It will be endorsed early next year, and implemented in 2018

title.narrative: Number of schools providing direct nutrition interventions
Number of islands with parents and care-givers of children under 2 years who has improved IYCF knowledge, by end 2019

Percentage of caregivers with knowledge of children's cognitive and psychosocial development by being responsive to the child's needs for care, and stimulating the child through talking, reading and other appropriate physicak and effective interactions
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Community health workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year

actual.value: 2017:Two trainings on Infant Young Child Feeding completed (one in North region, one in Central Region), & 52 Health workers & nurses trained

title.narrative: Number of primary caregivers of children aged 0-23 months who received IYCF counselling and messages through facility, community outreach, social media and other communication channels with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]
Country Programme incorporates early stimulation, protection and nutrition packages targeting children aged 0-3 (Including Care for Child Development)

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Existence of training curriculum on 'infant and young child feeding' that includes training on ?early childhood stimulation and development' for community workers/health service providers for outreach

actual.value: 2016:IYCF standards finalized by the Ministry of Health in 2016 and implementation initiated
